newsitem.title: USA: DOW INDUSTRIALS HIGHER AFTER REVERSAL.
newsitem.headline: DOW INDUSTRIALS HIGHER AFTER REVERSAL.

text.p: The Dow Industrials were slightly higher in late-morning trade Wednesday after the market staged its second sharp reversal of the day in volatile, seesaw dealings.
In Europe the dollar slid against the mark, weighing on the bond market.
The Dow, after rising more than 75 points at the opening, fell 140 points as bonds moved into the negative column. The Dow then recovered and by late morning was up nine points at 7970.
Nasdaq was up nearly five points at 1581.

The long bond was up 10/32 and back in positive territory but had still shed two-thirds of its earlier gains following news of a smaller-than-expected rise in U.S. July retail sales. The long bond yield was 6.65 percent.
